intro: Pentacalia ramentosa, commonly known as the woolly pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions as a decorative plant.
